meanings.definition: The quality or state of being black.
meanings.sent1: The blackness of the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The blackness of the coal made it difficult to see in the mine.
meanings.sent3: The blackness of the cat made it look like a tiny shadow creeping around.
meanings.sent4: The blackness of the storm clouds signaled an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The blackness of the ink on the paper contrasted sharply with the white background.

meanings.definition: The darkness or absence of light.
meanings.sent1: The blackness of the cave was unsettling.
meanings.sent2: She was afraid of the blackness that enveloped the room.
meanings.sent3: The blackness of the movie theater made it perfect for a horror film.
meanings.sent4: The blackness of the forest at night seemed to swallow all sound.
meanings.sent5: The blackness of the tunnel seemed endless, with no light in sight.

meanings.definition: The condition of having a dark skin color.
meanings.sent1: Her proud blackness shone through in her cultural attire.
meanings.sent2: The blackness of his skin was a source of pride in his heritage.
meanings.sent3: The blackness of her skin made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: His blackness was a symbol of resilience and strength in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The blackness of their skin united them in a shared history and experience.
